abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Social Assistance System
            Modernization Project for Ukraine were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was high; Bank performance was moderately satisfactory and
            borrower performance was also moderately satisfactory. Some
            lessons learned includes: financing of Information
            Analytical System for Social Assistance (ASSAP) operations
            should be secured to ensure sustainability. Multiple
            contingency plans should be made in case primary financing
            fails to materialize. Some of the costs could be covered by
            other budgets, such as funds allocated for the
            administrative functions of the Ministry of Social Policy
            (MOSP) or the social centers; even external donor funding
            may be a source for the MOSP to explore. Procurement methods
            affect the development process. Implementation of any kind
            of uniform system across a country with great variance in
            local capacity and attitudes requires strong oversight and
            control mechanisms at the central level. Currently, the
            Ministry is lacking virtually any capacity to coordinate
            activities with the regions and local welfare offices and to
            oversee their implementation, which needs to be taken into
            account by any follow-up operations. Sustainability of
            software, hardware, and knowledge to use the equipment must
            be addressed before and during implementation. Arrangements
            should be made at the outset of the project to ensure
            financing of equipment maintenance. A cost/benefit analysis
            will ease the process of securing funding for system
            operations, maintenance and further development. Using
            internal country systems where appropriate is a useful
            cost-saving measure and can help in building capacity.
